derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from Latin, feminine singular or neuter plural of harmonicus 'musical' (see harmonic)

entry.def: A harmonica is a small musical instrument. You play the harmonica by moving it across your lips and blowing and sucking air through it.

means.word_mean: 1. a small rectangular free-reed instrument having a row of free reeds set back in air holes and played by blowing into the desired hole
